application-ref-numbers.header: Which, if any, of the following reference numbers do you have?

items: A GWF number is given after you apply for a visa outside the UK.
An HO number is given after you apply within the UK.
An IHS number is given when you pay your immigration health surcharge.

accessibility.intro: This accessibility statement applies to the 'Additional Security Checks' service.
accessibility.intro-p2: This service is run by the Home Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibility.intro-p2-li1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
accessibility.intro-p2-li2: zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
accessibility.intro-p2-li3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
accessibility.intro-p2-li4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
accessibility.intro-p2-li5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
accessibility.intro-p3-pre-link: We’ve also made the text as simple as possible to understand.
accessibility.intro-p3-post-link: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
accessibility.reporting-header: Reporting accessibility problems with this website
accessibility.reporting-p1: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of our services. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, email:
accessibility.reporting-p2-link: Read tips on contacting organisations about inaccessible websites.
accessibility.enforcement-p1-pre-link: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
accessibility.enforcement-p1-link: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
accessibility.enforcement-p2: If you are in Northern Ireland and are not happy with how wee respond to your complaint you can contact the Equalities Commission for Northern Ireland who are responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations') in Northern Ireland.
accessibility.technical-info-header: Technical information about this website's accessibility
accessibility.technical-info-p1: The Home Office is committed to making its online services accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018
accessibility.compliance-p1: This website is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2, due to the non-compliances listed below.
accessibility.non-accessible-p1: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
accessibility.aware-issues: We are aware of the following and working to address the following issues
accessibility.non-compliance-li1: Some form elements, an aria-labelledby or aria-describedby reference exists but the target for the reference does not exist. Screen readers will not pick up on the relationship between the words and the input and so may progress without completing the action. This does not meet WCAG 1.3.1 Info and relationships and WCAG 4.1.2 Name, role, value standards and guidelines.
accessibility.non-compliance-li2: The session timeout of 30 minutes cannot be changed, and the user is not alerted when it is running out. This is for each individual page of the form, not the form overall. This does not meet WCAG 2.2 – Enough Time.
accessibility.non-compliance-li3: If you find an issue that we have yet to identify, please contact us using one of the routes described in the ‘Reporting accessibility problems with this website’ section of this statement.
accessibility.outside-scope-header: Content that's not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
accessibility.preparation-p1: This statement was prepared on 18 September 2024. It was last reviewed on 18 September 2023.
accessibility.preparation-p2: This website was last tested on 18 September 2024. The test was carried out internally by the Home Office.
accessibility.preparation-p3: We tested the service based on a user's ability to complete key journeys. All parts of the chosen journeys were tested, including documents. Journeys were chosen on a number of factors including usage statistics, risk assessments and subject matter.
